alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 15 at 10:24PM AKDT until March 16 at 6:00AM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW FOLLOWED BY HEAVY RAIN FOR SOUTHEAST ALASKA... .Snow continues to fall over the central and northern Panhandle this evening. Heavy snow over the far northern Panhandle will last through tonight and well into Thursday, especially at higher elevations and along the Klondike and Haines Highways. For those along the Icy Strait corridor, timing of the warming temperatures and the switch from snow to rain is expected to happen late Wednesday night into early Thursday morning. For Yakutat, the main plume of moisture will shift to the west with significant snow accumulations expected Friday afternoon into Friday night. There is still some uncertainty on where the heaviest plume of moisture will track. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to 5 inches, highest snow accumulations expected in Mendenhall Valley. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to change to rain by Thursday morning with warming temperatures. Heavy rain on existing snow pack and icy roads will make very slick conditions and travel difficult. Ponding of water in culverts, roadways, driveways, and yards is likely.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
